snippet: Some companies contend that federal loans for developing fuel-efficient cars have dried up because of a political firestorm that followed the bankruptcy last year of the solar panel company Solyndra.
abstract: More than $16 billion in loans authorized by Congress in 2007 to develop fuel-efficient vehicles has yet to be disbursed; some companies contend the loans have dried up because of a political firestorm that followed the 2011 bankruptcy of the solar panel company Solyndra.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and MATTHEW L. WALD

lead_paragraph: Some companies contend that federal loans for developing fuel-efficient cars have dried up because of a political firestorm that followed the bankruptcy last year of the solar panel company Solyndra.

headline.seo: Stalled Clean Energy Loan Program Feels Solyndra’s Chill
headline.main: Solyndra Is Blamed as Clean-Energy Loan Program Stalls
